description: Borderline eligibility when reported revenue equals the minimum threshold and requires confirmation of rounding policy.

input.context: Startup Lumen Labs reported FY23 revenue of exactly $1,500,000 and supplied an accountant letter noting figures are rounded to the nearest dollar.
input.question: Should we treat the revenue as meeting the minimum threshold?

expected.answer: Yes. Policy treats figures rounded to the nearest dollar as exact, so the applicant meets the minimum threshold.
expected.rationale: Eligibility guide 2.1 confirms no extra buffer is required when rounding precision is declared.

actual.answer: Yes. Policy treats figures rounded to the nearest dollar as exact, so the applicant meets the minimum threshold.
actual.notes: Validated with finance policy owner on 2024-10-05.
